synopsis: Genki wins a "Monster Rancher 200X" CD in a tounament. When he plays the CD he is pulled into the Monster Rancher world! There he meets Holly and Suezo and learns that their world is being threatened by Moo.

Genki and the gang arrive in a town, where a kind elderly couple invites them into their home. Genki, suddenly realizing the dangers ahead, asks if the couple can take Mocchi in. Mocchi, however, resists and runs away.
Genki and the gang come to a creepy castle in a forest. Inside they find Golem, a giant but gentle rock monster who protects the graves of dead monsters.

Upon defeating the Baddies Genki and the gang obtain a new Mystery Disc. It is, however, quickly stolen by a boy named Alan. Genki and Mocchi run after him but find they need to fight his monster, Worm, first.
A group of bandits led by Tiger of the Wind robs Genki and the gang of their Magic Stone. When the bandits return to their hideout they are attacked by the Baddies, and Tiger's brother is kidnapped.

When Genki and the gang run out of money, Tiger enters a tounament hoping to win the cash prize. In the final round, however, he is defeated by Hare's "Fart Attack." Later, Hare offers to buy the gang dinner.

Genki and the gang come to a beautiful valley with a small village at the foot of a dam. When Moo's troops damage the dam, the gang must first fight off the Baddies before working to prevent the village from being washed away.
Genki is back in his world, feeling lonely, and then wakes up. While Genki is telling his gang about his dream, he begins to think about Holly's past. Then, in the rain, Holly shares her story.
Genki and the gang arrive at a huge canyon called the "Heaven's Canyon." An old plane approaches them, carrying a man named Eddy  from the other side of the canyon.
The plane breaks down, and Genki and the gang are forced to land in an area ruled by the Baddies. There they find out that the humans are being enslaved into mining the ruins.
Genki and Mocchi head for North Town. They save the humans from the prison cave, but the Baddies show up, and a fierce monster battle ensues.
Genki and the gang discover a Mystery Disc. When they set it on the monster gate of a temple, Monolith appears and begins telling them the history of Monster Rancher in ancient times.
Moo's floating castle appears and blocks Genki and the gang's path. The gang's attacks on Moo are useless. In the end Holly is kidnapped and is taken inside the castle.
While Genki and the gang are trying to get into Moo's castle, Moo tells Holly that he is her father. She refuses to believe it but is shown a dagger, a memento of her father.

Genki and the gang succeed in escaping from the castle. The Magic Stone is guiding them towards and beyond the sea. At a small harbor they start looking for a ship, but are soon surrounded by the Baddies.
Guji and the Zillas attack the pirate ship that Genki and the gang are on. They capture Holly and try to squish her!
Genki and the gang reach land and head for a cave that might take them to the other side of the cliff. When Hare runs off after an argument with Tiger, Joker suddenly appears!
While walking through a jungle Genki and the gang find Henger's arm. When they begin searching the forest for other body parts they come across an ancient city.

Suezo, tired of being criticized by Hare and Tiger about his weak attack abilities, begins working on a new Special Attack with Genki and Mocchi. But he keeps making mistakes and gets even more depressed.

Pixie and Blue Mountain join Genki and the gang in fighting off a surprise attack, but they all fall off the cliff and lose each other. Genki, carrying the injured Pixie, begins searching for the others.
Genki and the gang arrive in Silk City, but a tornado sweeps them up and drops them in front of an old castle. There, Gali, one of Moo's Big Four, appears and invites them inside for a meal.
Genki and the gang learn that Tiger's brother is one of Moo's Big Four. When Holly is poisoned in a battle, Genki and Tiger run out in search of a medicinal herb, but an assassin is after them!

To rescue Genki and the gang who have been captured by the Moks, Mocchi asks for help from Ducken. But Ducken is a bit of a chicken and won't say yes. Without Ducken's help Mocchi may not be able to save the gang!
Golem meets Undine, a beautiful water spirit. She asks him to be her friend and he says yes, but it turns out to be a trap!
While being chased by Salamandars, Genki and the gang discover and hide out in a ruin. The three warriors there force the Salamandars to retreat. But are the warriors friend or foe?
Genki and the gang take cover from rain and thunder in an ancient weapons factory. When JaggerNauts appear and attack them a robot named Melcarba quickly destroys them.
Gray Wolf Challenges his brother, Tiger of the Wind, to a one to one duel to settle things, who will be the victor?

title.jp: Color Pandora, Guardian of the Forest

synopsis: Genki and the gang are walking through a forest rigged with traps. When Genki and Hare set out to find out who is responsible for all the traps, they find Color Pandora.

At the Yellow River, Genki and the gang meet Jim and his Eared Mew. They pay Jim and get into his boat to cross the river. Genki, watching Jim as he operates the boat, begins to see his father in him.
Passing through a forest Genki and the gang find a stone with mysterious writing on it. When they break it they discover an underground temple full of red Mystery Discs!
Genki and the gang are excited to come across an abandoned amusement park. While they are busy having fun and are distracted, a Baddie appears and kidnaps Mocchi!
A mysterious merchant named Niton eyes Holly's dagger and asks if she will trade it for his Phoenix Disc. Holly hesitates but in the end makes the trade!

The Tainted Cat Brothers attacks Genki and the gang. They are so strong the gang barely escapes, with Genki and Mocchi falling off a cliff. When the two regain consciousness they see a mysterious monster standing over them!
Bajarl, one of Naga's most powerful warriors, attacks and traps Genki and the gang in a jar. Holly and Mocchi escape, and while ruuning they stumble upon a ghost town.

title.jp: Battle With the Big Bad Four

synopsis: Genki and the gang infiltrate Naga's headquarters to take out the last of the Big Bad Four!

Moo is finally merged with his body and immediately begins his search for Genki and the gang. The gang has just arrived at a small village, where the villagers say once a year an ogre comes to kidnap their children!

Holly seems restless hearing the news of Moo's recent merge with his body. Watching her Suezo suddenly remembers that today is her birthday! Hare talks to everyone about throwing her a surprise party.
Moo orders General Durahan to destroy Genki and the gang. Durahan in turn orders the same to End Bringer, the type of fighter Genki has never before fought against.
Durahan sends Chariot and a pack of Salamanders to attack Genki and the gang. The gang escapes into a forest, where they find a white-furred monster named Baku who quickly becomes attached to Genki.

title.jp: The Secret of Holly's Magic Stone

synopsis: Genki and the gang come across an ancient ruins. They meet Colt, an archaeologist, who tells them of the ancient Monster Ranch, from which the gang learns something new about the secret of the birth of Moo.
Genki and Tiger, while looking for food in the forest, are attacked by a Jagd Hound. Tiger chases after it wondering why the Hound does not have any Baddie insignia.
Durahan unleashes a squadron of Astros to destroy Genki and the gang. The gang escape into a cave and hide in the spaceship ruin that they find, but the Astros are not far behind!

Genki and the gang find what looks like an apple tree. They are all hungry, but there is only one apple, and the gang begins fighting over it. When it accidentally falls into Mocchi's mouth, Genki is furious!
Durahan sends the Gangsters robots after Genki and the gang to take the Magic Stone. Can Genki and the gang defeat the robots that can reassemble themselves?
Durahan succeeds in robbing Genki of the Magic Stone, but something is not right. It seems his forces have turned on him. Just then Genki and the gang teleport into his battleship for a fight!
Genki and the gang decides to head north. On the way they meet Jill, a monster covered in fur. Moo, in the meantime, drinks up the Magic Stone's power and reappears in front of the gang.

Genki and the gang are battling with Moo, with great difficulty. Pixie and the Pirate Dragons come to help but Pixie gets seriously injured. All the time, Moo himself is experiencing some technical problems of his own.
While Moo has gone berserk and is destroying everything, Monol is telling Genki how to wake up the Phoenix, but it is such a brutal, unthinkable procedure! Can the gang stop Moo from his craziness?
